I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. Some people may think it's vulgar, sexist, misogynic and repulsive as it shows full frontal male and female nudity, graphic and casual sex with one character being homosexual and another prong of the love triangle having a gender reidentification problem. A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The phrases, “Hate” and “Milk” were heard throughout the film.
